main.track: Where I End and You Begin

comments.comment: A perfect mix of new and old echoing through the colorado sky.

Absolutely amazing beyond words breathtaking. Best concert I have ever attended. Phenomenal venue and a fittingly phenomenal band. A perfect summer night in GodÂ’s country, the air was electric with naturally beautiful surroundings, a great audience, spectacular lights and a stunning musicianship. Thom Yorke was a gracious host giving ultimate respect to the fans and if I didn't know any better, I'd say the band saved their best of this tour for the Red Rocks show. Legendary stuff, man....

Totally awesome. A fabulous evening of sight and sound. Without a doubt, the best show to come to Denver this year and maybe for several years. Red Rocks is like no other and it's great to see a band choose to play here over the bigger, less attracive venues in Denver. It speaks volumes for Radiohead and their ultimate understanding of the big picture. The visuals were superb and blended with the performance very well. And, this was definitely the smartest audience I've ever been a part of. For those that are interested, here is a links to the local reviews in the Rocky Mountain News and the Denver Post: http://www.rockymountainnews.com/drmn/music/article/0,1299,DRMN_54_2212443,00.html
http://www.denverpost.com/Stories/0,1413,36%257E28704%257E1594960,00.html
Red Rocks lit up by Thom and the boys with the Denver skyline out in the black. Doesn't get much better.
